IEC/ISA 62443 IACS Cybersecurity Design & Implementation – April 2019
IEC/ISA 62443 IACS Cybersecurity Operations & Maintenance – April 2019
CAREER SUMMARY
2014 to date Capgemini / Leidos / Lockheed Martin – Aberdeen,
Position: Process Control Security Consultant
Selected Projects:
Conoco Phillips UK – OT Compliance Project
ConocoPhillips UK (CoP) had a requirement to comply with ConocoPhillips Global Engineering Standard and UK HSE standards across the Greater Britannia Assets (GBA) and JBlock assets. All assets were to be remediated and compliant by the end of 2018 in preparation for an internal audit April 2019. Steps carried out included:
Carried out Review and cross reference the identified documentation
Agreed and designed appropriate CoP UK documentation set
Performed verification of controls compliance against approved CoP UK documentation set and identified gaps
Performed agreed remediation activity aligned with CoP UK expectation
Nexen (CNOC) - ICMS Cyber Security Support project
Reviewed the UK Policy and Procedures and advise on content, structure, and gaps for meeting the global standard
Created new procedures based on gaps identified
Review and update System Registers & Network Diagrams
Facilitate HAZAN & Criticality Ranking based on systems identified during site visits
Tullow - Jubilee Shutdown
Consultant delivering technical architecture review and full documentation set for the Jubilee FPSO in Ghana after completion GAP analysis on site. Tasks include:
Change network design and configuration to suit a 3 Tier architecture as defined in ISA/IEC 62443
Define and implement firewall rules to ensure access is limited to authorised personnel and systems
Lock down the individual switch ports on all networks to unique MAC addresses to ensure that no unauthorised equipment can successfully connect to the network
Remove systems from the network and relocate them in a control network DMZ where they can be accessed by the relevant personnel
Create new and review and update documentation
PCN Security Sustainment Programme
Technical Lead with a team of 4 dedicated to supporting Chevron North Sea assets. Tasks include:
Security policy, process, and procedure development
Annual, bi-annual and ad-hoc offshore and onshore visits
Security architecture reviews
Vulnerability, compliance, and risk assessment
PCN security awareness training, development, and delivery
Application whitelisting deployment, management, and support
Inventory management & network surveys
Gap analysis and remediation planning
Chevron’s Captain Enhanced Oil Recovery
Reviewing all vendor documentation for accuracy and compliance against the Chevron standards for PCN security
Checking specification, selection, procurement & installation of security technologies such as firewalls, IDS, data diodes, white listing, etc
Advisor on control system network architecture / topology design
Other non-project related parts of the role include:
Acting as a mentor to other team members
Representing the company at trade shows / conferences
Jan 2013 – Oct 2014 Chevron – Aberdeen
Position: PCN IRM Coordinator
Primary PCN IRM contact for CUE advising and directing on securing Process Control Networks comprised of PLC, SCADA, and HMI systems in adherence to CIRS policies standards and technical controls
Assisting the business unit with meeting compliance requirements to meet corporate audit expectations
Project management of the PCN compliance improvement projects within Chevron Upstream Europe and developing evergreen processes
Heavily involved in coordinating and directing contract vendors in addition to guiding onsite operational personnel. Involvement in overseeing the compliance activities for PCN design, installation, commissioning, and maintenance

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
